description: Emergency Medical Advice and Telemedicine Support for the Canadian Coast Guard on board vessels
full_summary:
# Tender Announcement: Emergency Medical Advice and Telemedicine Support for the Canadian Coast Guard

## Title
Emergency Medical Advice and Telemedicine Support for the Canadian Coast Guard on Board Vessels(Titre original) Fourniture de conseils médicaux d'urgence et de soutien en télémédecine à la Garde côtière canadienne à bord des navires.

## Reference Number
cb-419-30278965

## Solicitation Number
30005498A

## Tender Closing Date
Please be advised that the tender has expired as its closing date has passed.

## Description
The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) Health Officers program aims to provide preventive, primary health care, and occupational health care nursing services to the ship's complement aboard Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) CCG vessels during arctic and scientific voyages in remote areas.

A contractor is required to provide timely medical advice and reporting services to CCG Health Officers. The desired outcome is to reduce the need for medical evacuations by managing patient treatment on board the vessels.

Health consultations will be conducted via phone and/or internet by emergency physicians supporting CCG Health Officers in remote locations.

## Evaluation Criteria
Requests will be evaluated based on the contractor's expertise in medical assessment and treatment, scope of practice, and relevant professional standards.

Results of the assessment will be provided to the CCG National Coordinator of the Health Officers program on a monthly basis, a minimum.

## Attachment
The relevant tender documents, including the RFP and Addendum 1, can be found [here](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/37424/30005498a---rfp-emergency-medical-advice-and-telemedicine-support-for-the-canadian-coast-guard-on-board-vessels_0.pdf).

## Additional Information
Please direct any questions or inquiries to Louise Martel, Contracting Officer, tel: (819) 962-7325 or email: [louise.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:louve.martel@dfo-mpo.gc.ca).
